class src.grounding.Domain(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Enum representing the domain or codomain of a OldGroundingFunction

Domain enums can be automatically combined using an addition operation:

Domain.STATE + Domain.ACTION == Domain.STATE_ACTION
ACTION = 2¶
ANY = 1¶
BOOLEAN = 7¶
FACTOR_STATE = 17¶
NEXT_STATE = 5¶
REAL_VALUE = 11¶
REWARD = 19¶
STATE = 3¶
STATE_ACTION = 6¶
STATE_ACTION_NEXT_STATE = 30¶
STATE_NEXT_STATE = 15¶
STATE_VALUE = 13¶
classmethod from_name(name: str) → rlang.src.grounding.internals.Domain¶

Bases: rlang.src.grounding.groundings.GroundingFunction

  • name (optional) – the name of the grounding.

  • domain (optional [str]) – the domain of the Factor.

class src.grounding.Feature(function: Callable, name: Optional[str] = None, domain: Union[str, rlang.src.grounding.internals.Domain] = Domain.STATE)¶

Bases: src.grounding.groundings.GroundingFunction

Represents a feature of the state space.

Can represent any function of the state space.

Parameters

  • function – a function of state.

  • name (optional) – the name of the grounding.

  • domain (optional [str]) – the domain of the Feature.

class src.grounding.Grounding(name=None)¶

Bases: object

Parent class for all grounded objects.

property name¶
class src.grounding.GroundingFunction(domain: Union[str, rlang.src.grounding.internals.Domain], codomain: Union[str, rlang.src.grounding.internals.Domain], function: Callable, name: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: rlang.src.grounding.groundings.Grounding

Parent class for groundings which are functions.

GroundingFunctions have a specified domain and codomain. They are typically invoked with keyword arguments corresponding to their domain:

door_closed(state=s)
Parameters

  • domain – Domain of the function.

  • codomain – Codomain of the function.

  • function – the actual function.

  • name (optional) – the name of the Grounding.

property codomain¶
contains(item)¶
property domain¶
property function¶

class src.grounding.Option(initiation: src.grounding.groundings.Predicate, policy: src.grounding.groundings.PolicyOld, termination: src.grounding.groundings.Predicate, name: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: src.grounding.groundings.Grounding

Grounding object for an option.

Parameters

  • initiation – A Predicate capturing the initiation set of the option.

  • policy – A PolicyOld capturing the policy of the option.

  • termination – A Predicate capturing the termination set of the option.

  • name (optional) – the name of the grounding.

can_initiate(*args, **kwargs) → bool¶

Determines whether the option can be executed in a given state.

Parameters

state – A State object.

Returns

True iff the option can be executed in the given state.

Return type

bool

class src.grounding.Predicate(function: Callable, name: Optional[str] = None, domain: Union[str, rlang.src.grounding.internals.Domain] = Domain.STATE)¶

Bases: src.grounding.groundings.GroundingFunction

Represents a function which has a truth value.

A Predicate is a feature with a codomain restricted to True or False.

Parameters

  • function – a function of state that evaluates to a bool.

  • name (optional) – the name of the grounding.

  • domain (optional [str]) – the domain of the Predicate.

classmethod from_PrimitiveGrounding(primitive_grounding: src.grounding.groundings.PrimitiveGrounding)¶
class src.grounding.Prediction(grounding_function: src.grounding.groundings.GroundingFunction, value: Any, name: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: src.grounding.groundings.GroundingFunction

GroundingFunction for a prediction for the value of a GroundingFunction.

This should be used for Factors, Features, and Predicates which are limited to functions of (state) or (state, action).

Parameters

  • grounding_function – a GroundingFunction

  • value – the predicted value of the GroundingFunction (can also be a GroundingFunction)

property predicted_grounding¶
class src.grounding.RLangKnowledge¶

Bases: collections.abc.MutableMapping

Acts as a container for Groundings.

Acts just like a Python dictionary.

Examples

base = RLangKnowledge()
base['x_location'] = Factor([1])

  • action – Action, optional

class src.grounding.State(input_array: Any)¶

Bases: rlang.src.grounding.internals.BatchedPrimitive

Represents a State object.

RLang expects MDP states to always be of a single dimension. This class makes it easy to batch single-dimensional states together.

Parameters

input_array – a numpy array or list representing a state or set of states.

Examples

s1 = State(3)
>> State([[3]])
s2 = State([3, 4])
>> State([[3, 4]]})
s3 = State([[3, 4], [5, 6]])
Factor([0])(state=s3)
>> State([[3], [5]])
